However, many STIs can 
affect	your	babyâ€™s	health	
during pregnancy and after

to believe that you or your 
partner has an STI, you 
should go for a check-up as 
soon as you can. You can 
ask your GP or midwife, or go 
to a genitourinary medicine 
(GUM) or sexual health clinic.
